page.title: 09SEA VIEW
page.content: Sea View is a small settlement of 8 terraced houses situated at the highest point of our area.They were probably built in the early 1900's ,to house workers in the China Clay industry and certainly before the age of the car as there are galvanised iron garages more recently built . Six of the houses are rendered with mortar ,two unusually for Cornwall are built of red brick.The roofs are made of slate .Two still have water taps outside ,it was most probably called Sea View because you can see the sea from this high point .At the front of the houses are small gardens ,not very well maintained .Small iron gates provide entrance to properties .Some windows were broken .The overall impression was one of an isolated settlement in need of some care and attention .
